verse: King ·Xerxes [Ahasuerus] demanded ·taxes everywhere, even from the cities [tribute on the land and] on the seacoast.

And all the great ·things [achievements] ·Xerxes [Ahasuerus] did by his ·power [authority] and strength ·are [are they not…?] written in the ·record books [chronicles; annals] of the kings of Media and Persia. Also written in those record books are all the things done by Mordecai, whom the king made great.

Mordecai the Jew was second in importance to King ·Xerxes [Ahasuerus], and he was ·the most important man [great; powerful; preeminent] among the Jews. His fellow Jews ·respected [admired; esteemed] him very much, because he ·worked for [sought] the good of his people and ·spoke up [interceded; advocated] for the ·safety [welfare; peace] of all the Jews.
